page.title: 07SHROTON BUILDINGS:HOUSING
page.content: MOST{HOUSES}HAVE BEEN THERE SINCE MEDIEVAL TIMES AND HAVE THATCHED ROOFS AND LEADED WINDOWS. MANY COTTAGES HAVE BEEN RESTORED AND REBUILT SEVERAL TIMES THROUGH THE AGES. INSIDE WE WERE OFTEN SHOWN OLD BLACK BEAMS AND COB WALLS AND TOLD OF THE EARLY USE OF THE BUILDINGS. THERE WAS AN OLD PRISON, COBBLERS SHOP AND ALMSHOUSES. THERE ARE A NUMBER OF 18TH CENT. HOUSES INCLUDING THE RECTORY, NOW CONVERTED INTO SMALL FLATS, STEPLETON HOUSE SET IN PARKLAND ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE MAIN ROAD AND A NUMBER OF COMFORTABLE FARMHOUSES. IN CONTRAST THERE ARE 3 GROUPS OF LUXURIOUS MODERN HOUSES IN PRETTY GARDENS. THOSE OPPOSITE THE POST OFFICE ARE SET ROUND A VILLAGE GREEN. THERE ARE ALSO A NUMBER OF ROWS OF COUNCIL HOUSES SCATTERED ABOUT INCLUDING BUNGALOWS FOR THE ELDERLY.
